AddOnInstructionDefinition.Name: WaterCircuit
AddOnInstructionDefinition.Description: Closed water circuit based on Micro820

Parameter.Name: Reset
Parameter.Description: Reset WTU C1&C2 on falling edge of reset signal

Parameter.Name: PID_Kc
Parameter.Description:
Proportional and Integral are dependent on this gain. (>= 0.0001).
Increasing Kc improves response time but also increases overshoot and oscillation of the PID.

Parameter.Name: PID_Ti
Parameter.Description:
Time integral constant in seconds (>= 0.0001).
Increasing Ti decreases the overshoot and oscillation of the PID.

Parameter.Name: PID_Td
Parameter.Description:
Time derivative constant in seconds (>= 0.0).
When Td equals 0, there is no derivative action and PID becomes a PI controller.
Increasing Td reduces the overshot and removes the oscillation of the PID controller.

Parameter.Name: PID_FC
Parameter.Description:
Filter constant (>= 0.0). Recommended range for FC is 0 to 20.
Increasing FC smooths the response of the PID controller.

Parameter.Name: ALARM_CommunicationFaulted
Parameter.Description: Communication faulted, check IP address in MSG instruction

Parameter.Name: ALARM_Active
Parameter.Description: Alarm is active, outputs will NOT be activated on WTU

Parameter.Name: Enable_Communication
Parameter.Description: set to true if messages can be send to micro820

Parameter.Name: cnf_Select_Circuit
Parameter.Description:
assign AOI to watercircuit based on:
1 = C1 2 = C2

Parameter.Name: HMI_Color
Parameter.Description: 0 = off 1 = auto turned on 2 = manual control 3= no communication

LocalTag.Name: wrk_conversion
LocalTag.Description: conversion tag to go from LREAL to DINT

LocalTag.Name: TagName
LocalTag.Description: Contains tag name based on addon name

Routine.Name: Logic
Routine.Description: Closed water circuit based on Micro820

STContent.Line: // Closed water circuit based on Micro820
MSG(Msg_Read); // Message to read object. CIP datatable read.
MSG(Msg_Write); // Message to Write object. CIP datatable write.
if Reset AND (Msg_Read.ER OR Msg_Write.ER) then
#region Convert IO from Micro820 to local
// IS ALLREADY A REAL, DOESNT NEED CONVERSION! // Micro820 tag: HMI_I_C1_Kc
// IS ALLREADY A REAL, DOESNT NEED CONVERSION! // Micro820 tag: HMI_I_C1_Ti
// IS ALLREADY A REAL, DOESNT NEED CONVERSION! // Micro820 tag: HMI_I_C1_Td
// IS ALLREADY A REAL, DOESNT NEED CONVERSION! // Micro820 tag: HMI_I_C1_FC
// IS ALLREADY A REAL, DOESNT NEED CONVERSION! // Micro820 tag: HMI_I_C1_PID_Setpoint
// IS ALLREADY A REAL, DOESNT NEED CONVERSION! // Micro820 tag: HMI_I_C1_PID_HandValue
if (Enable_Communication AND Sts_Communication_OK ) AND Select_Mode AND NOT Start then // Auto - Turned off
elsif (Enable_Communication AND Sts_Communication_OK ) AND Select_Mode AND Start then // Auto - Turned on
elsif (Enable_Communication AND Sts_Communication_OK ) AND NOT Select_Mode then // Manual - controlled manually
elsif (Enable_Communication AND NOT Sts_Communication_OK ) then // No connection
elsif NOT Enable_Communication then // No connection
if HMI_Trend_MaxValue=0 AND HMI_Trend_MinValue=0 then HMI_Trend_MaxValue:=100;HMI_Trend_MinValue:=0; end_if;
